ASHTRAY.Definition: a small dish or container for tobacco ash and cigarette ends

SACRED.Definition: related to religion or to a god

HOLY.Definition: related to religion or to a god

PRAYER.Definition: request for help or expression of thanks addressed to a god

OVERBOARD.Definition: over the side of the ship and into the water

HABIT.Definition: something that is done regularly and is hard to give up

SUPPOSED.Definition: believed or assumed to be true

POWDER.Definition: a substance in the form of very small pieces

INHALE.Definition: breathe it up into the nose

SNUFF.Definition: ground tobacco seeds in the form of a powder taken into the nose

SNUFF-TAKING.Definition: the practice of breathing ground tobacco seeds into the nose

PLANTATIONS.Definition: large farms in which the particular crop was grown

BEGGARS.Definition: poor people who live by asking people for money or food

RATION PACKS.Definition: packages containing food and other useful items

TRENCH.Definition: long narrow hole in the ground used for cover during war

COUGH.Definition: force air out through the throat with a short loud sound

CONTRIBUTED.Definition: played a part in, helped to cause

COUGHING.Definition: forcing air out through the throat with a short loud sound

ADDICTIVE.Definition: something harmful that is difficult to stop or limit

STIMULANT.Definition: a substance that raises the levels of activity in the body

FUNDAMENTAL.Definition: forming the base, of central importance

TO SOME EXTENT.Definition: to a certain degree or level

SPARED NO EXPENSE.Definition: spent as much money as needed

COLOGNE.Definition: liquid with a pleasant smell, used on the skin

MILD.Definition: moderate in effect, not having big impact

SUSPECT.Definition: not to be trusted, possibly wrong

FIGHTING A LOSING BATTLE.Definition: fighting a battle that they could not win

UNDERMINE.Definition: make it less likely to succeed

HELL-BENT.Definition: very determined or decided to achieve it

TRY AS IT MIGHT.Definition: no matter how hard they tried

CHRONIC.Definition: continuing or lasting for a long time

TAKING IT UP.Definition: becoming interested or involved in it

PLAINTIFFS.Definition: people in the case who made the legal complaint

SHORTAGE.Definition: situation in which there aren't enough

TAKING UP.Definition: becoming interested or involved in it

VAPOUR.Definition: gas resulting from the heating of a liquid

ENACT.Definition: make (for a law), put into action

ALL OF THIS BEGS THE QUESTION.Definition: all of this causes us to ask the question

WEAN ITSELF OFF.Definition: slowly stop doing it or be free of

FOR ALL ITS TALK.Definition: even though there's been lots of talking

GOING DOWN WITHOUT A FIGHT.Definition: going to give up without resistance or easily
